<summary>
• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels like wood waste, aiming to improve efficiency and reduce pollution compared to conventional hog fuel burners.
• The invention seeks to create a clean-burning waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate matter, operates effectively with wet wood up to 70% moisture content, and is self-regulating with fast response times.
• It aims to produce little to no slag or clinkers, even with nominal ash content fuels, by maintaining primary chamber temperatures below the melting point of ash and other inorganic substances.
• The burner operates with less than stoichiometric air proportions in the primary chamber and about 20% excess in the secondary chamber, optimizing combustion and minimizing excess air.
• The design includes a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up to dry and gasify the waste, with swirl air promoting centrifugal separation of particulates.
• Secondary combustion air is introduced tangentially in the secondary chamber to complete combustion, with the air flow adjusted based on moisture content and fuel type.
• A unique aspect of the invention is its adaptability to various dirty particulate-laden combustible gases, not limited to wood waste, for clean burning and particulate removal.
• The burner includes a primary combustion chamber with adjustable tuyeres for air flow, a secondary chamber with adjustable tuyeres for air flow and positioning, and a pressure isolator to prevent primary air from entering the secondary chamber.
• The invention features a flame holder that acts as a barrier against particulate while allowing gas flow, and a refractory lining protected by an outer vortex of combustion air.
• The system allows for quick adjustment of fuel feed and air flow, with response times much faster than conventional burners, enabling rapid changes in heating output.
• The burner design minimizes the need for frequent cleaning, extends the life of the refractory lining, and allows for a smaller boiler due to cleaner discharge gases.
• The control system is pneumatic but can also be electrical,

* The invention is an efficient evaporative refrigeration system that separates evaporating water from the cooling air stream using a heat exchanger, avoiding the addition of water vapor to the air and achieving sensible cooling.
* The system can be enhanced with a hybrid evaporative cooler incorporating a vapor compression refrigeration unit for further dehumidification, resulting in a lower temperature and reduced energy consumption.

* This application relates to pumps, particularly for pumping fluids like liquid manure from animal husbandry operations, and claims the benefit of U.S. patent application 62/055,020.
* The application describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads in series, each housing an impeller driven by a drive structure, to pump fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure.
* The pump heads are connected by a drive structure that commonly drives the impellers, and can be powered by a single power source like a motor.
* The pump heads may comprise a combiner for combining fluid flow from the conduits into a single flow, and may be connected to each other to form a fluid flow path between pump heads.
* The pump heads may be removably connected or formed in a unitary structure for modularity and ease of repair or expansion.
* The pump assembly may be mounted on a support structure like a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer for operation at a fluid reservoir.
* The pump can be used to pump fluids from a reservoir into a holding tank, with the ability to mix the fluid in the reservoir using an agitator nozzle.
* The pump design allows for flexibility in the number of pump heads in the series, enabling adjustment of the operating pressure.
* The pump design includes features to prevent fluid from entering the drive train and protect the drive shafts from corrosion and befouling.

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for engines with less than all cylinders.
• Traditional engine brake systems typically include a brake for each cylinder, leading to excess components if not all cylinders are used.
• The present invention aims to reduce engine components by providing brakes for only a portion of the engine cylinders.
• The invention includes an engine with a housing defining multiple cylinders and a brake for each portion of these cylinders.
• The method involves attaching a brake to a portion of the engine cylinders and operating them in a braking mode.
• Each brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
• The invention allows for a modular number of brakes, enabling customers to choose the desired braking horsepower.
• The brake system can be adapted to various engine configurations and cylinder counts.
• The invention can use different types of brake structures, including modular ones.
• The brake can be separate from the exhaust valve or integrated with it.
• The invention provides a more robust engine by reducing the number of components.
• The invention includes a detailed description and drawings illustrating the engine and brake system.
• The invention is intended to be applicable to various industrial applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads such as blade-off events in gas turbine engines.
• The link assembly includes a male link coupled to either the engine or gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or gearbox, and a pin releasably coupled to both links to form a radial interface that dampens translation and selectively retains the links.
• The technical function of the embodiments is to allow relative translation of the male link while dampening its motion and retaining the links.
• The female link includes a mounting end for attachment to the engine or gearbox and an interface end for receiving the male link.
• The male link includes a mounting end for attachment to the engine or gearbox and an interface end for receiving the female link.
• The pin is designed to selectively prevent relative translation of the links and can shear under extreme loads, providing a fusible link that absorbs shocks without transmitting destructive loads.
• The radial interface between the links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy from translation, with the damping force determined by the materials and geometry of the links.
• The snap ring can limit the travel of the male link within the female link after the pin shears.
• The invention obviates the need for all linkages and connections to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.
• The pin can be replaced during maintenance after a shock sufficient to break it.
• The terminology used is illustrative and not limiting, and the embodiments can include various modifications and alterations.
• The invention is particularly aimed at aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes and their connections to engines.
• The embodiments are not limited by the described features and can include other suitable materials and geometries.
• The invention provides a solution to the need for rigid connections that can withstand extreme loads without overconstraining the gearbox or engine.
• The invention aims to prevent damage to the gearbox and its peripherals by absorbing extreme shocks and preventing detachment.
• The invention can be applied to any number and location of peripheral load connections supported by the gearbox.

* The invention introduces a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight to achieve perfect arrow balance.
* It includes a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance the arrow shaft, and a point cap and balance pin design that work together.
* The invention also provides a means to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft and is suited to the use of unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts.

<summary>
• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training, providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.
• It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing with a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system, installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The invention produces sound and flash by electrically igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space, venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, offering a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device.
• The invention aims to simulate small arms fire noise and flash, provide inexpensive realistic training using an actual weapon, and simulate small arms fire without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber.
• The circuitry of the Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) includes a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and MILES interface, all designed to work together to simulate the firing of live rounds.
• The plastic expendable contains pyrotechnic charges that burn in a combination mode to produce overpressure levels and duration simulating small arms fire when the pressure ruptures the plastic sealant covering the exit orifice.
• The invention has been described with reference to a preferred embodiment, but additions, deletions, modifications, and substitutions are allowed within the appended claims.
• The invention is particularly relevant for training with the standard M16 automatic weapon, where it offers a cost-effective alternative to using blanks and a blank fire adapter.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an air intake device for internal combustion engines that improves performance by optimizing the dynamic effect of air flow while reducing noise.
• The device includes a tank with a first pipe interconnecting the tank to the air intake passage, and a second pipe with a smaller cross-sectional area, also interconnecting the tank to the intake passage, located closer to the air cleaner.
• A valve in the first pipe, actuated by a vacuum diaphragm actuator, opens or closes in response to engine operating conditions, allowing for the adjustment of the air intake volume.
• The invention aims to reduce noise by using a narrow passage as a resonator and to improve performance by creating a compound volumetric efficiency curve through controlled valve operation based on engine speed and load.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner designed for interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances.
* The burner features a combustion chamber with an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, facilitating initial and secondary combustion, and a shroud for tertiary combustion air and safety.
* The burner includes legs for elevation, an ash pan with a cover for cleanliness and safety, and manual couplings for various modular heat utilizing appliances like cookers and a pyrolyzer.
* The burner supports efficient, clean burning with reduced emissions and can be used with diverse appliances, including those for cooking, smoking, space heating, and pyrolysis.
* The burner can be equipped with a fuel feed feature for continuous operation and can be adapted for various configurations and safety features.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention aims to improve ignition and cooling systems in rotary internal combustion engines to maintain efficient combustion and reduce structural failure risks.
* It introduces a housing structure that enhances circumferential cooling flow and minimizes thermal distortion around spark plug bosses.
* The design features staggered spark plug bosses in a circumferential cooling flow passageway, offset from a centerline to promote a controlled flow regime and prevent vapor film formation.
* Flow diverters or flow controllers are used between bosses to ensure a controlled flow regime and reinforce the housing structure.
* The invention seeks to increase the heat transfer coefficient at the spark plug boss zone by at least 20% over prior art capabilities.
* The staggered arrangement of bosses allows for a high heat transfer coefficient by avoiding uncontrolled swirling eddies and maintaining high-velocity flow.
* Tests show that the staggered configuration can increase the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to an in-line arrangement.
* The invention is important for boss spacings up to 50 diameters of the bosses, and for spacings up to 12 diameters when boss diameter is large relative to the cooling passage width.
* The offset of spark plug terminals is crucial for achieving the benefits of the invention, with an ideal offset being less than the radius of a boss.
* The invention is particularly relevant for rotary engines with a peripheral cooling circuit and aims to improve cooling characteristics and engine performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance in turbines during periodic operational testing of control valves by using valve positions as feedback.
• It maintains constant total mass flow through parallel turbine inlet flow control valves, keeping steam generator pressure and inlet pressure regulator unaffected.
• The method involves determining flow characteristics for systems with N valves and N-1 valves, and applying the difference in flow characteristics to compensate for changes when one valve is closed for testing.
• A test compensation circuit is used to adjust flow through parallel control valves based on valve stem lift, minimizing flow disturbance during valve testing.
• The invention has been tested and shown to reduce pressure excursions by 95% compared to control without flow compensation.
• The invention is not limited to the disclosed embodiment and covers various modifications and equivalent arrangements within its spirit and scope.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet.
• The valve allows a proportional mixture of two fluids, ranging from 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other.
• It provides stand-alone cleaning apparatus for multiple users to control the strength of the cleaning solution without disrupting others.
• The valve body includes a first inlet for soap solution, a second inlet for water, and an outlet passage for the mixture.
• The valve has an adjustable valve means to direct the two fluids toward the outlet passage.
• The valve system allows continuous analog control of the mixture proportions and maintains constant fluid pressures at the inlets.
• The valve system can operate multiple identical valve systems from a common source without affecting fluid pressures.
• The valve system includes a flow restricting device to reduce the flow rate of the soap solution and a bore size to reduce the flow rate of water.
• The valve system uses fluid seal rings to prevent commingling and leakage of the two fluids.
• The valve system can be constructed from components with a predetermined loose fit and includes a manual adjustment handle for controlling the mixture proportion.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling gas in a compressor station for gas pipelines, particularly in permanent frost areas, to reduce investment and operation risks associated with conventional re-cooling plants.
* The method includes compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure, which inherently cools the gas.
* The arrangement features a compressor station with multiple compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and electronic control units, with the ability to recover drive energy from expansion turbines.
* The invention allows for year-round operation of the compressor station, with the ability to adjust the excess pressure and expansion based on seasonal temperature variations, resulting in lower investment and energy costs compared to conventional re-cooling technology.

<summary>
* The present invention introduces a cooling fan assembly system that eliminates the need for traditional fasteners like screws, dowel pins, or rivets used to secure cooling fans to enclosures in various applications.
* The system is applicable in any application where forced air movement is used for cooling, such as automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation industries.
* The cooling fan assembly includes a motor that rotates a fan blade to move warm air from the enclosure interior to the exterior.
* The motor housing is integrally formed with a motor carrier that has resilient legs and spring members to secure the fan assembly to the panel without fasteners.
* The resilient legs have turned-out portions that fit into enlarged openings on the panel, and spring members that urge the carrier away from the panel to prevent disengagement.
* The installation process involves bringing the fan assembly into a load position, applying a combined compressive and rotating force to move the assembly into a partially installed position, and then fully installing it by capturing the legs in a residual opening.
* The spring members also help prevent vibrational noise and forces from causing the legs to disengage from their respective openings.
* The invention allows for various modifications or additions to the preferred embodiments without departing from the spirit of the invention.
* The subject matter of the invention extends to all fair equivalents as defined in the appended claims.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from damaging flight loads.
* The mounts incorporate passive energy dissipating mechanisms and can be added to existing kinematic mount structures.
* The design uses six identical strut elements to simplify manufacturing and reduce costs.
* The invention aims to achieve modal vibration tests with damping values from 5-17% of critical damping, significantly improving performance over existing designs.
</summary>

* The invention relates to large size oil shear type clutch units, particularly for aircraft catapult systems, with interleaved clutch plates and discs that are alternately clamped or separated in an axial direction.
* The invention aims to overcome disadvantages of previous clutch constructions, especially for large power transmission requirements, by providing strong coupling forces, high control accuracy, and minimized residual drag.
* The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for both retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs, with the ability to replace clutch disc segments without complete disassembly.
* The invention features segmental clutch discs for easy replacement, improved cooling through better oil flow control, and minimized disc friction for improved torque control, with a design that reduces residual drag to less than 500 horsepower in an 85,000 horsepower clutch.

• The invention relates to an internal combustion engine that incorporates downstream expansion cylinders associated with a combustion cylinder to significantly lower the temperature of fluids, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.
• The invention also includes a catalytic material on surfaces that "see" hot exhaust gases for impurity conversion within the engine, and a water recovery system for reusing water injected into the engine.
• Additionally, the invention features gearing between expansion and combustion cylinders to optimize engine output and reduce the need for a radiator.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a fabrication process for steel plates or blanks intended for welding and heat treatment, aiming to achieve parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance, particularly for the automotive industry.
• The process involves coating steel plates with an aluminum-based precoat, followed by selective removal of the metal alloy layer on one face of the plate to prevent intermetallic compound formation during welding.
• The remaining intermetallic alloy layer provides corrosion resistance and good mechanical properties after heat treatment and deformation.
• The invention allows for the fabrication of parts with varying mechanical properties within the same part, without the need for costly or unnecessary operations on all parts.
• The process is compatible with existing welding lines and can be integrated into current manufacturing processes, with a preference for laser welding due to its flexibility and quality.
• The invention also includes methods for monitoring the removal of the metal alloy layer, either by visual inspection or by measuring changes in emissivity or reflectivity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) system for remotely controlling a mobile structure that optimally extracts energy from severe weather patterns in offshore environments.
* The SCADA system uses an algorithm that optimizes energy extraction by considering weather observations and sensor data, adjusting the mobile structure's navigation and operational parameters.
* The system includes computer servers that gather data from GPS, weather satellites, and other sources, running Human Machine Interface (HMI) software for secure communication with microprocessor systems on the mobile structure.
* The microprocessor systems on the mobile structure control various mechanisms, such as rudder rotation, propeller speed, and sail trim, to optimize energy extraction and navigation.
* The SCADA system includes a central service facility for data aggregation, storage, and distribution, with the ability to remotely interact with the system through a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
* The system can track the position and velocity of the mobile structure using GPS and weather satellite data, and adjust the mobile structure's course based on predictive models and real-time data.
* The system can also detect and avoid physical objects using integrated sensors and video camera data streams, adjusting the mobile structure's course to avoid potential hazards.
* The SCADA system can be used for both energy extraction and logistics-only navigation, with the ability to prioritize cost or yield goals.
* The invention is not limited to a specific energy recovery system but applies to any mobile system that exploits energy from weather patterns under remote control.
* The system's algorithm can be used without considering energy extraction yield factors, guiding navigation for logistics purposes past hazardous weather patterns.
* The invention enables remote operation of mobile structures in environments that present risks to human crews, making previously undesirable energy exploitation systems economically viable.
* The system's GUI allows human operators to interact with the system, adjusting control parameters and monitoring performance.
* The invention is exemplified by a system that includes a sailing vessel with an energy-extracting turbine appendage, but the principles can be applied to various mobile structures and energy recovery systems.
* The invention aims to optimize energy extraction while minimizing risks and costs, making previously

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage manufactured using a ring element composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined in the circumferential direction and connected via welding.
* The invention aims to reduce production costs by minimizing waste material during manufacturing.
* The ring element is formed from sheet metal and has axial profiling created through forming techniques.
* The flat material ring segments are joined in succession in the circumferential direction, with welding performed in the region of engagement zones.
* The joint contours are designed to ensure adequate coupling with minimal weld seam length and preferably with a tapered angle towards the ring element edges.
* The flat material ring segments are 120° segments, allowing for only three weld points to join the ring element.
* The ring segments can be punched out in succession from a sheet metal strip, with circular edges and joint geometries cut out in one step.
* The invention is suitable for manufacturing both radial and axial bearing cages, with the possibility of using mirror-symmetry for structurally identical ring elements.
* Welding can be performed using laser welding or pressure welding, with the option to retain material accumulations for a stronger weld.
* The ring segments can be initially oversized and then calibrated after welding, or cut to final dimensions before welding.
* The ring segments can be punched out and joined in a rotary plate, with the process overlapping chronologically and preferably using laser beam welding.
* The invention allows for high-quality weld connection points, with material beads generated before or during punching to ensure complete weld seam filling.
* The invention includes various embodiments of ring elements and cages for different types of bearings, with the possibility of additional wire ring elements for increased strength.
* The invention includes detailed drawings illustrating the ring element structure, the process of forming the cage, and alternative joint contours.
* The invention also includes a list of reference numbers for specific features such as beads and depressions.
* The invention is particularly advantageous for cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm, where process costs are lower than material cutting

* The invention relates to methods and systems for acquiring and transmitting information to facilitate efficient customer service in telecommunications networks, particularly through the use of global satellite positioning for precise location tracking and routing of service technicians.
* The invention includes a system where a service technician inputs location data at a customer service location, which is processed to obtain latitude and longitude coordinates, updated in various databases, and used to generate driving directions for service technicians between customer service locations.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor.
* The system aims to provide homogeneous compensation for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
* It includes a control unit, typically a DSP or FPGA, that processes signals from two real triaxial magnetic field sensors.
* The control unit uses an averaging algorithm to create virtual sensor signals that represent the interfering field's amplitude at the object's location.
* The system employs independent control loops that transform virtual sensor signals into modified signals, which are then used to calculate control signals for compensation coils.
* The control algorithm can be linear or nonlinear, and the system can be optimized for different applications.
* The system can compensate for inhomogeneous fields without generating a homogeneous compensation field, using a single coil instead of a pair of Helmholtz coils.
* The system can operate with two compensation systems in close proximity, with a feedback matrix to minimize interference between the systems.
* The system can be used in various applications, such as imaging systems and scanning electron microscopes.
* The invention provides a solution to the problem of direct measurement of interfering fields at the object's location and the issue of undesired feedback effects between adjacent compensation systems.
* The system's design allows for adjustments to control tasks without significant user intervention.
* The invention can be applied to scenarios where multiple objects are placed closely together and require individual magnetic field compensation.
* The system's control structure can be experimentally determined by measuring the feedback between two installed systems.
* The invention claims priority from a German patent application filed in 2009.
* The system's design and operation are illustrated in accompanying figures.
* The invention is described in detail, with examples and schematic representations, to provide a comprehensive understanding of the technology.
* The invention's advantages include improved compensation field homogeneity, adaptability to different interference scenarios, and reduced feedback effects between adjacent systems.
* The invention's potential applications extend to various fields requiring precise magnetic field control.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a method for enhancing CARS microscopy by introducing at least one resonance site into a biological sample using a bioorthogonal reaction, enabling species-selective imaging without additional tagging.
* The method allows for the selective accentuation of structures in a sample, improving specificity and signal strength for CARS microscopy, and is particularly suitable for tagging in biological samples.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for assessing radiation therapy segmentations, comparing them to a "gold standard" or among different software systems to identify discrepancies.
* Segmentations are input as electronic files, converted to volume models, and compared to find common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* The comparison process can be customized with a metric method that weights errors based on their distance from the reference volume, emphasizing errors far from the desired segmentation surface.
* The system provides a graphical display to intuitively assess segmentation quality, highlighting common elements, missing elements, and extra elements.
* The system allows for customization of the metric method, including constant, linear, and exponential functions of error volume elements and distance.
* A histogram display reveals systematic distance errors and trends in error related to distance.
* The system automatically matches metric methods to structures based on common descriptors in the electronic files.
* The system can be used for training, evaluation, and quality assurance of radiation therapy segmentations and autosegmentation routines.
* The system assists in determining whether a new treatment plan is needed due to changes in patient anatomy during therapy.
* The invention is not limited to the embodiments and illustrations contained herein but includes modified forms and combinations of elements within the scope of the claims.
* The invention can be used for assessing segmentations from different sources, including clinicians and software systems, to improve segmentation skills and autosegmentation programs.
* The system can be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when updated or used with new imaging technology.
* The system can be used for assessing segmentations against underlying data used for segmentation, providing instructive detail for skill improvement or autosegmentation program assessment.
* The system can be used for comparing segmentations from different sources, including clinicians in training or different software systems, to improve segmentation quality.
* The system can be used for comparing segmentations from different software systems, including those from different vendors, to improve autosegmentation routines.
* The system can be used for comparing segmentations from different software systems, including those from different vendors, to improve autosegmentation routines.
* The system can be used for comparing segmentations from

<summary>
* The invention relates to a data processing system with improved apparatus for executing floating point operations.
* The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.
* It utilizes a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to speed up the subtraction process.
* The procedure begins based on the difference between a subset of operand exponent argument signals before the complete difference is known.
* The invention reduces the number of steps in the effective subtraction operation by using a subset difference.
* The subset difference allows for the determination of the correct operand fractions without the need for additional computation when the complete difference is known.
* The invention accelerates the computation by initiating the correct operation before the complete difference between the operand arguments is determined.
* The invention's operation is illustrated with a block diagram and detailed description of the preferred embodiment.
* The scope of the invention is limited only by the claims and can include variations apparent to those skilled in the art.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and system for tracking and collecting patient specimens in medical facilities, aiming to reduce mislabeling and improve efficiency.
• It involves storing machine-readable codes on patient ID means, orders, specimen-taker ID means, and specimen containers in computer storage accessible by standalone or networked computers.
• The system selects a specimen container with a unique preapplied barcode and matches it with the patient's ID and order barcodes, ensuring the specimen is collected from the correct patient and order.
• Upon successful collection, the system generates a signal to place the specimen in the container and stores the event in a relational manner in the computer storage.
• The system can also track the expiration date of specimen containers and alert if a container is out-of-date.
• The invention includes a method for correcting discrepancies in patient-order relationships and ensures that specimen collection is completed within a predetermined time.
• The system eliminates the need for vial labels and associated printing, reducing costs and labor.
• The invention can be implemented with various types of computers and storage, connected via wired or wireless networks, and is not limited to blood specimens but can be used for any biological specimen.
• The invention provides a failsafe, zero-defect process for specimen collection and processing, with the potential for modifications and alterations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that provides verbal information to users, such as golfers, about distances and other golf course parameters.
• It uses GPS technology to convert coordinates to measure distance and other factors, and voice recognition technology to accept voice commands.
• The device can be incorporated into headgear like a golf hat or visor, and may also use other distance measuring technologies.
• It can memorize and compute data to predict golf strategy, club selection, and other player needs, using algorithms based on past performance.
• The device can be used for various applications beyond golf, such as hiking, surveying, hunting, and scuba diving, and can be expanded for use in any portable application.
• It may include Bluetooth technology for data transfer, audio communication, remote GPS, and recording geographic coordinates of a golf course.
• The device can facilitate the calculation of geographic distances between the user and course features, and provide advice based on the user's past performance.
• The invention is intended to cover various modifications and embodiments that fall within the scope of the claims.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to semiconductor design technology, specifically systems and techniques for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs).
* It addresses the challenge of verifying integrated circuits that include both memory and logic components, which have different sizing, performance, and scaling issues.
* The invention provides a system and method for checking design rules that accurately reports errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes both logic and memory circuits.
* It eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions not subject to the same design rules and helps pinpoint real design rule errors in the mask pattern data.
* The invention creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions, based on modifying standard logic rules to accommodate the more liberal values available for memory regions.
* The invention can be applied to any mask pattern database and is implemented using conventional computing systems with appropriate software routines and libraries.
* The invention categorizes results into different error groups based on where they occur, such as in Logic, BDSP SRAM, BLSP SRAM, DP SRAM, and ROM groups.
* The invention is intended to find significant usage in the semiconductor industry and similar industries where different design rules must be applied to different types of regions on a substrate.

<summary>
• The invention relates to waveguide holograms used as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
• The invention utilizes thin substrate waveguides for controlled illumination, avoiding space and alignment issues of conventional systems.
• Waveguide holograms (WGHs) offer high diffraction efficiencies and uniform illumination, with the undiffracted light never entering the observer's eye.
• The invention addresses non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront and the two-sidedness of the diffracted beams, with potential solutions including a priori and a posteriori compensation, and specific architectural configurations for recording the WGH grating.
• The invention allows for the selective illumination of objects, such as SLMs, by diffracting only polarized light and using polarization analyzers.
• The invention has been disclosed with reference to generic description and specific embodiments, with the examples set forth not intended to be limiting.
• The invention has been supported by the U.S. Government under contract F300606-88-D-0025 awarded by the Rome Air Development Center, Department of the Air Force.
• The invention is a continuation-in-part of U.S. Patent application Ser. No. 07/790,516.
</summary>

* The invention provides a non-destructive method and apparatus for testing the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of dynamoelectric machine rotors, such as those in induction motors, to identify defects.
* The apparatus comprises a test head that causes relative angular movement between the rotor and test head, with exciting means to magnetize the rotor and voltage and current sensing means to generate signals responsive to the rotor's magnetic flux variations.
* The processing means determines the rotor's resistance, reactance, and effective skew from the signals, and provides automatic pass/fail determinations based on predetermined threshold values.
* The apparatus includes a data acquisition, processing, and control system that controls the test sequence, acquires data, processes it, and displays results, with the capability to store statistical data for analysis over multiple tests.

* The disclosure provides a method for securing mobile devices by granting managed libraries access to native resources based on validated digital certificates, while denying managed applications the same access.
* The method includes a manager that validates requests from managed applications to access native system resources through managed libraries, using information from digital certificates.
* The manager can be effectuated by native instructions and can authorize or deny access based on the managed library's certificate.
* The disclosure also includes a process for receiving and verifying packages from a networked computer system, ensuring type-safe code and managed metadata before storing them in a digitally signed container.
* The disclosure allows for the secure execution of third-party applications on closed mobile devices by using a runtime host effectuated by native instructions, with managed libraries authorized to access specific native resources.
* The disclosure provides alternative embodiments for securing computing devices, publishing videogames, and managing electronic marketplaces for mobile applications, with various operational procedures and flowcharts illustrating the processes.

* The invention introduces an improved identification card featuring an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers, which are then encased between rigid outer layers.
* The card's structure differs from prior art by using rigid materials throughout, protecting the electronic components from damage due to external stresses and bending.
* The invention offers a low-cost, easily constructed identification card with enhanced protection for the IC chip and antenna, and includes various security features.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a memory implementation of a FIFO queue, particularly for functional memories, using a tree-shaped structure to reduce copying during updates.
* The tree-shaped structure comprises nodes with a maximum size and maintains leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level.
* Additions and deletions are directed to leaf nodes, ensuring all leaf nodes are at the same level and new nodes are created as needed.
* Updates require copying only the path from the root to the update point, resulting in logarithmic time and space complexity.
* The tree structure can be inverted in constant time and space, with a header node indicating the beginning and end of the queue.
* The header node simplifies updates, as it only needs to be copied when the end node is full, and the queue can be accessed efficiently by following tree edges.
* The invention allows for a double-ended queue (deque) functionality, with the ability to add or delete records from both ends.
* The invention can be modified to accommodate variable node sizes or different maximum sizes at each tree level.
* Records can be stored separately from the tree structure, allowing for efficient memory usage and scalability.
* The invention includes a control logic for managing additions and deletions, with input and output registers for record pointers.
* The invention can be implemented in a memory arrangement with separate registers for the end and beginning of the queue and a flag register for queue inversion.
* The invention aims to improve upon traditional FIFO queue implementations by reducing the overhead of copying during updates in functional memories.
* The invention provides a novel way to implement FIFO queues in memory, optimizing for functional memory environments.
* The invention's tree-shaped structure and header node design enable efficient and flexible queue management.
* The invention's approach to queue management can be adapted to various memory architectures and functional requirements.
* The invention's design aims to provide a scalable and efficient solution for managing FIFO queues in memory.
* The invention's tree-shaped structure and header node design can be applied to various computing systems and applications.
* The invention's approach to queue management can be extended to support additional queue operations and features.
* The invention's design can be integrated with existing memory technologies and systems

* The invention provides practical methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, specifically for DRAM redundancy circuits and standard logic technologies without high voltage requirements.
* The invention utilizes novel device structures, such as DRAM storage capacitors as EPROM coupling capacitors and transistor properties changed under stress conditions, to achieve these objectives without complicating existing manufacture technologies.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for quickly and accurately determining the optimum feedback gain values for control systems, such as automatic guidance vehicles, to ensure stability, accuracy, and response.
• The method involves a trial-and-error process where feedback gains are provisionally set, control is executed, and evaluation values are calculated based on the resulting control performance.
• Evaluation values are derived from the length of the error curve plotted against time (for proportional gain), the integral of the error (for integral gain), and the integral of the absolute error (for differential gain).
• The optimum feedback gain values are determined by finding the gain values that correspond to the minimum evaluation value for stability, zero for accuracy, and zero for response.
• The method can be applied to any feedback control system and is not limited to specific gain values or evaluation functions.
• The invention can be implemented with existing automatic guidance vehicle systems and can be adapted to different control objectives and conditions.
• The method allows for the determination of optimum feedback gains in a short period of time, regardless of the complexity of the control system or the conditions under which it operates.
• The invention can be used to improve the performance of control systems in various applications, including but not limited to automotive, aerospace, and industrial process control.
• The invention is applicable to systems where feedback control is used, and the method can be used to optimize the control characteristics for any desired performance criteria.
</summary>

<summary>• The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and high optical performance over the zooming range, while minimizing physical size and total length.
• The invention addresses the demand for zoom lenses in video cameras to achieve high relative apertures with reduced size, using a 1/2 in. image pickup tube.
• The invention comprises a zoom lens with specific conditions for the construction and arrangement of lens elements to correct aberrations throughout the zooming range.
• The invention achieves a reduction in the total length of the zoom lens system, with examples demonstrating lengths as short as 8.0698φ A to 9.19φ A, while maintaining high optical performance.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles like protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, where a charge pulse generated by a particle passing through the detector is converted into an electric signal, which can be individually amplified or integrated.
* The invention aims to overcome the limitations of prior art by allowing both the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals without prior knowledge of expected signal rates.
* Discharging of a charge pulse or signal from the detector is performed on the low-voltage side, simplifying the distinction of small-size signals and avoiding excessive noise.
* Individual signals are amplified in a fast amplifier, while signals are integrated in a slow amplifier upon exceeding a threshold value of the rate of the signals.
* Separation of signals as a function of the rate is achieved using capacitors and inductors before the amplifiers, allowing for adjustable measuring ranges and the detection of individual signals or pulses as well as their integration.
* The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material for the detection of uncharged particles, generating electric pulses when uncharged particles pass through.
* Fast charge transport at room temperature materials like diamond are proposed for detecting particles over wide ranges of signal rates or large bandwidths.
* The invention is applicable for detecting particles in particle accelerators, reactors, diagnostic devices, and medical technology, as well as in electrical power engineering applications.
* The device includes a support capacitor to compensate for detector discharges at high rates, maintaining functionality and preventing errors from leakage currents in high-voltage cables.
* The detector can be optimized for wave resistance to match the input impedance of preamplifiers and cables, improving read-out performance.
* The invention allows for the detection of particle packets, enabling the assessment of overall particle rates.
* The simultaneous detection and integration of individual signals or pulses can be used for monitoring in various applications, including supervision of particle beams and medical imaging processes.
* The invention provides a reliable and simple separation during the detection of signals of elementary particles, facilitating both individual pulse detection and integration.
</summary>

• This invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies in friction clutches, aiming to enhance efficiency and provide automatic operation without manual intervention.
• The apparatus includes an enclosure with stationary and movable rings, a torque motor, and an electronic sensor to measure the distance between the rings and detect assembly rotation.
• The torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, attempting to rotate it against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• The apparatus measures the distance between the rings and the amount of rotation of the driven disc assembly, comparing it to standard values to determine if the assembly is within specified tolerances.
• The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad, minimizing operator error.
• The apparatus can store specific measurements for each assembly tested, facilitating statistical process control.
• The invention is designed to replace a prior test fixture that was slow, required manual operations, and lacked an external indication of test results.
• The invention is objected to provide an automatic spin checking machine that operates without manual involvement and generates an external indication of test results.
• The invention is also objected to provide an improved apparatus for spin checking a driven disc assembly, which automatically determines the assembly's condition.
• The invention is objected to provide an automatic spin checking apparatus which generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
• The invention is objected to provide an improved apparatus for spin checking a driven disc assembly which operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator.
• The invention is objected to provide an automatic spin checking machine which generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
• The invention is objected to provide an improved apparatus for spin checking a driven disc assembly which operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator.
• The invention is objected to provide an automatic spin checking apparatus which generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.

<summary>
• The invention relates to methods, systems, and software for face age-estimation, incorporating government-supported research.
• It addresses the challenges of accurately estimating human face age due to factors like gender, ethnicity, and environmental influences.
• The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) to extract robust facial features that encode age information.
• Two aging functions are constructed to represent different aging periods, such as early childhood and adulthood.
• An age classifier distinguishes between youth and adults, using support vector machines (SVMs) trained on feature vectors.
• The face age-estimation system uses the appropriate aging function based on the classified age group to estimate the age of a face.
• The system can be implemented on various computing devices and includes a feature extractor, mapping unit, and machine-executable instructions.
• The invention can be used in applications like surveillance, age-restricted business access, and criminal identification.
• The system can be integrated into a computing system with components like a processor, memory, input device, video display adapter, and storage device.
• The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments and configurations described, allowing for various implementations.
• The invention can be used in real-time applications without user cooperation.
• The invention can be adapted to account for image defects or abnormalities during the age-estimation process.
• The invention can be used to generate age indicators with corresponding confidence factors.
• The invention can be used in conjunction with databases, the Internet, and security systems for face age-estimation results.
• The invention can be used in a variety of real-world scenarios, including automated control systems and surveillance technologies.
• The invention can be used to prevent underage access to unacceptable media or programming.
• The invention can be used to thwart underage individuals from driving cars before reaching legal driving age.
• The invention can be used to identify trends in business relative to the ages of customers.
• The invention can be used in homeland security technologies and management of electronic customer relationships.
• The invention can be used to improve verification rates for image-based face age-estimation.

<summary>• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, preserving the definition of the higher definition image.
• The device comprises a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in identical arrangements, with dedicated pixels for each image.
• The controller can apply light intensity signals for each image or a combination of both, and can implement attenuation functions for the signals.
• The invention allows for different pixel arrangements, such as squares of four pixels, with dedicated colors for each image.
• The controller can apply different formulas for signal combination, allowing for color restoration and contrast enhancement.
• The device can display multiple images with dedicated pixels for each, optimizing display area and consumption.
• The invention includes practical examples of combining images from different sensors, with adjustable parameters for intensity correction and color balance.
• The device can also display multiple images simultaneously, with dedicated pixels for each image and the ability to use complementary colors for maximum resolution.

<summary>• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for motor vehicle security systems, enabling keyless activation and payment functionalities.
• The transmitter includes a removable payment element for cashless transactions, which can be secured in the housing when not in use.
• The transmitter can communicate with a payment system for financial transactions, and the payment element can execute remote transactions.
• The transmitter has a secure state that prevents unauthorized payment actions and protects the electronics from environmental damage.
• The transmitter can include an energy storage device for powering the electronics and payment element, with a redundancy for added reliability.
• The transmitter can have a communication range of less than 20 cm and cryptographic communication with the payment system for enhanced security.
• The transmitter can also serve as an advertisement board with printed information.

<summary>
• An imaging device enters sleep mode to save energy and may experience decreased tribo charge in toner, affecting image quality after inactivity.
• Exemplary embodiments include methods and apparatuses for charging toner based on periods of inactivity to maintain image quality.
• A TC sensor measures toner concentration by detecting tribo charge, adjusting toner supply accordingly.
• A method determines periods of inactivity, predicts next usage, and calculates toner charge decay to adjust toner charge upon machine awakening.
• An intelligent toner charging system monitors user patterns, predicts next usage, and calculates tribo charge decay.
• The system charges toner and developer based on calculated decay to ensure consistent image quality.
• The system can be implemented in software or hardware using standard logic circuits or VLSI design.
• Various embodiments can be combined or modified for different systems or applications.
• The disclosed methods and apparatuses are intended to cover all alternatives, modifications, and equivalents within the spirit and scope of the disclosure.
• The disclosure includes a detailed description of exemplary embodiments, illustrated with figures.
• The disclosure is incorporated by reference into the entirety of U.S. patent application No. ______.
• The disclosure is not limited to any one embodiment but is intended to cover all alternatives, modifications, and equivalents within the scope of the claims.
• The disclosure is intended to cover all suitable printing devices, including printers, copiers, fax machines, and others.
• The disclosure may be implemented using any known or later developed systems, devices, software, or microprocessor systems without undue experimentation.
• The disclosure may be implemented in software using object or object-oriented environments or in hardware using standard logic circuits or VLSI design.
• The disclosure may be implemented in software or hardware using any known or later developed systems, devices, software, or microprocessor systems without undue experimentation.
• The disclosure may be implemented in software using any known or later developed systems, devices, software, or microprocessor systems without undue experimentation.
• The disclosure may be implemented in software using any known or later developed systems, devices, software, or microprocessor systems without undue experimentation.

• The invention provides a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that allows for precise and independent control of bias currents to multiple magneto resistive (MR) heads mounted on a rotary drum, using a single control signal channel and digital control data, which enables high-density recording/reproducing with high precision and minimal signal loss.
• The apparatus includes a control signal generator on the stationary side, a decoder circuit on the rotary drum side, and a current supply circuit on the rotary drum side, all working together to ensure optimal operation of each MR head during recording and reproduction.
• The invention can be applied to various types of recording/reproducing apparatuses, not limited to those with MR heads, and can handle both digital and frequency-modulated analog signals, with the potential for high-speed data transfer and reduced cross-talk between signal channels.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to enable hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• It includes a selector switch for switching between conventional telephone operation and automatic answering mode, with a timer to control the call duration and a bypass switch to extend the call.
• The invention provides a modular, portable system that can be easily connected to various telephone jacks, reducing installation costs and maximizing versatility.
• The apparatus is designed to be simple, safe, reliable, and low-cost, with a minimum of components, and is particularly useful for individuals with physical limitations or those needing hands-free communication during tasks.
• The invention includes two embodiments: an electronic system with an optocoupler circuit and an electromechanical system using a neon lamp and photocell.
• The invention aims to improve upon prior art systems by providing a more convenient, versatile, and cost-effective solution for hands-free telephone communication.
</summary>

* The invention relates to optical fiber communications, specifically system network design with branch powered amplification.
* The invention aims to reduce or eliminate undersea optical repeaters by using remotely pumped optical amplifiers powered by energy distributed over the same branch cables that carry communications signals.
* The system includes a trunk configured in ring topology with telecommunications hubs and branching units, allowing for add/drop points and signal routing.
* Optical energy at a wavelength different from signal wavelength is used to power optical amplifiers within the trunk, branching units, or hubs, eliminating the need for conventional repeaters.
* The system maintains full connectivity even if a single trunk or branch cable is cut, with branch cuts only isolating the affected branch, not compromising the ring's integrity.
* The network respects sovereignty concerns and can accommodate reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units, not restricted to fixed wavelength routing schemes.
* The repeaterless technology reduces capital, operating, and maintenance costs of communications networks.
* The invention can be applied to undersea and terrestrial communications systems and is not limited to a specific number of hubs or branch assemblies.
* The system can handle wavelength-division-multiplexing (WDM) signals and other multiplexing methods, with the preferred wavelengths for signals in the 1500-1600 nm range due to low attenuation losses in single mode fibers.

* The invention provides a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that hides fasteners and can be easily installed or removed, even on non-flat walls.
* The device consists of a two-part system: an attachment member installed over the wiring device and a cover plate with saw-tooth shaped racks and latching pawls for locking, allowing the cover plate to be pried off using a small tool.

* The invention introduces a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, featuring annular strips that are concentrically nested and enclosing one another tightly, with a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, allowing for various angular positions relative to the screen.
* The device includes hook or locking elements for secure folding and an adapter member with a flat attachment face for versatile placement on different monitor types.

* The invention relates to automated speech technologies that provide feedback to speakers when their rate of speech may be too fast for listeners to comprehend, particularly in non-native language contexts.
* The solution involves a device that monitors the speaker's rate of speech and compares it to a listener's comprehension threshold, which can vary based on language proficiency.
* The device can use various sensory mechanisms to alert the speaker to slow down, such as vibrations, visual cues, or spoken messages.
* The invention can be implemented in wearable devices, integrated into teleprompter systems, or as networked devices that communicate with remote processing units.
* The system can also suggest language alternatives if the speaker and listener share proficiency in a language other than the one being spoken, potentially improving comprehension.
* The invention can be realized in hardware, software, or a combination of both, and can be distributed across interconnected computer systems or embedded in computer program products.

* The invention introduces a device for enhancing the frequency of TV recordings of rapid processes, allowing for higher resolution in time without increasing spatial resolution.
* The device modifies a TV camera by incorporating a cyclic line counter and a sawtooth generator synchronized with the counter's output pulses, enabling the scanning beam to run over N lines of a picture plane successively and cyclically.
* The line counter's counting capacity is programmable, allowing for selectable line scanning frequencies, and the sawtooth generator's control is adjusted via a delay device for precise timing.
* The invention can be applied to various types of rapid processes, including IR, UV, or X-ray pictures, and the recorded video signals can be digitized for analysis, with the option to complete jumped-over lines by interpolation or repetition of preceding lines.

<summary>
• The invention relates to multimedia communications, specifically a technique for handling multimedia calls with legacy phones and services.
• It addresses the need for integrating multimedia capabilities with existing circuit-switched and packet-switched calls without replacing legacy equipment.
• The invention introduces a "blended call" concept, combining voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session managed by blender software on multimedia servers.
• Incoming calls from clients with blended capabilities are routed to multimedia servers, which handle the call with voice and multimedia components.
• Outgoing calls from blended-capable users are also managed by multimedia servers, with the option to integrate voice components back to the telephony server with a loopback indication to prevent infinite loops.
• The invention is well-suited for use with Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) environments and can be adapted to various network systems and protocols.
• The invention aims to extend the viability of existing network devices and customer premises equipment by supporting multimedia capabilities.
• The invention includes detailed methodologies for handling incoming and outgoing multimedia calls, with the ability to manage signaling paths and bearer paths for multimedia services.
• The invention can be implemented using software or embedded sequential logic, and it can be integrated with Intelligent Network (IN) systems for additional functionality.
</summary>

<summary>• The invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices that allows for contextual synchronization over various network topologies, utilizing dynamic attributes and file bundles, and is scalable, efficient, and supports multiple languages and character sets.
• The framework comprises a central reference point that processes synchronization requests, prioritizes file downloads, and returns file description bundles to the client, which then downloads and confirms the files, handling incomplete bundles by resuming from the last successful download.
• The system employs data compression for responses to optimize bandwidth usage and supports the creation of delta lists by the client device to determine files to download, with the ability to resume synchronization from the last successful download in case of connection disruptions.
• The invention also includes a synchronization method that involves a client device sending contextual information to a central reference point, which then compiles a response with file bundles, prioritizes downloads, and the client device downloads and updates files based on the response, with the ability to handle incomplete downloads and optimize the download order.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for allowing anonymous communication between a finder of a lost or misplaced object and the owner of that object.
* It provides a unique ID to the owner, allowing them to register an association between the ID and their contact information, and associate the ID with a virtual locale (e.g., a website address).
* The system includes a virtual locale, a database for storing the association between owner contact information and a unique ID, and a module for forwarding finder communications to the owner.
* The owner can register their tag IDs and contact information on a centralized, network-accessible database.
* The system allows for anonymity in communication, with the finder and owner only sharing the unique ID and the virtual locale.
* The invention includes various embodiments and can be implemented using different programming languages, operating systems, and database systems.
* The system can be used to facilitate the return of lost or misplaced objects to their owners, overcoming the drawbacks of previous systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to electron multipliers used in photomultipliers and particle detectors, with a focus on a foil electron multiplier design.
• The foil electron multiplier uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages.
• The foil and anode are contained within a supporting structure attached within an evacuated enclosure, with an electrical power supply providing an electric field gradient.
• The foil electron multiplier can be used for amplification of incident electron flux or detection of particles, and is suitable for electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.
• The foil electron multiplier has advantages over conventional multipliers, including higher gain per stage, simpler fabrication, lower cost, larger area coverage, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback.
• The foil electron multiplier design uses thin foils with a specific thickness and applied voltage to maximize electron transmission and secondary electron emission yield.
• The foil electron multiplier does not experience ion feedback, as ions generated at the input surface of a foil are accelerated toward the previous stage and cannot penetrate the foil.
• The foil electron multiplier can be constructed using carbon foils with a range of thicknesses and applied voltages, and is compatible with various supporting grid materials.
• The foil electron multiplier has been demonstrated to have a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers, with a maximum gain achieved at an applied voltage per stage of approximately -650 V.
• The invention is intended to be defined by the claims appended hereto, and many modifications and variations are possible.
• The embodiments were chosen and described to best explain the principles of the invention and its practical application.
• The invention is intended to enable others skilled in the art to utilize the invention in various embodiments and with various modifications suited to the particular use contemplated.
• The invention was made with government support under Contract No. W-7405-ENG-36 awarded by the U.S. Department of Energy.
• The government has certain rights in the invention.
• The invention is particularly relevant to electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.
• The invention is

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system that allows any motion picture to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect effortlessly by the viewer.
• It claims priority from U.S. Provisional Applications filed in 2001 and 2002, incorporating their contents.
• The system utilizes the Pulfrich effect to create a 3D visual experience without special glasses or filming techniques.
• The system includes viewing glasses with individually controllable lenses and a digital sensor to capture successive frames of the motion picture.
• A computer processor processes the captured frames to identify synchronization events and control the darkness of the lenses accordingly.
• The glasses can take three states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear, depending on the detected motion in the motion picture.
• The system works with any form of media, including film, digital, TV, DVD, and computer screens.
• The invention provides benefits such as no need for special filming or projection equipment, compatibility with existing media formats, and reduced eyestrain due to selective activation of the 3D effect.
• The system can be integrated into existing glasses or designed to fit over regular prescription glasses.
• The invention can be extended to other visual effects and algorithms for detecting motion in motion pictures.
• The system uses substances that change color and transparency, such as liquid crystals, to control the lens states.
• The invention includes miniature special purpose computers and digital photo sensors for processing and capturing images.
• The lens control algorithm can detect various types of motion and use this information to control the lens states for a 3D effect.
• The system can potentially correct for head movement and use it to adjust the 3D effect.
• The invention aims to overcome the problems of 3D motion pictures and make them more widely accepted.
• The system is battery-powered and operates in real-time, providing a seamless 3D viewing experience.
• The invention has the potential to enhance the enjoyment of moviegoers by expanding the visual effects available in motion pictures.

* The invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure that deflects ionic emission gas away from the field emission components to prevent damage.
* The device includes at least one reduction plate or electrode on the cathode to alter the discharge path of ionized gases and prevent electrical surges to the cathode.
* The reduction plates or electrodes can be elongated, run parallel and adjacent to rows of field emission elements, or arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among the field emission elements.
* The protection structure is fabricated using conventional deposition and etching techniques, with the reduction plates formed on the same plane as the cathode strips.
* The reduction plates are typically made of any electrically-conductive metal and are separated from the cathode by an insulation layer.
* The bias voltage source applies a negative voltage to the reduction plates to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions, preventing them from contacting the cathode strips and inducing current surges.
* The invention aims to substantially prolong the lifetime of field emission elements in the device.

* The invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, addressing limitations of prior art single-plane sensors.
* The sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with P-type material and doped layers, allowing light to be captured from edge surfaces in addition to a top surface.
* The sensor features a P-type substrate with a highly doped bottom layer and a lightly doped upper layer, forming image sensor elements with buried-channel CCDs.
* P+ layers between edge surfaces and image sensor elements guide charge carriers toward the CCDs, enabling edge-surface imaging.
* The sensor can image in multiple planes, useful for simultaneous imaging of opposing surfaces or surface imaging of passageways.
* The invention can be easily incorporated into various types of known image sensors using compatible processing techniques.
* The sensor's design includes a first imaging plane on the top surface, and two additional imaging planes on the edge surfaces, with P+ layers guiding charge carriers laterally toward the CCDs.
* The sensor's design improves charge collection and reduces crosstalk, with the potential for color applications using filters over different imaging planes.
* The sensor can be mounted in a way that avoids interference from external connections on the imaging surfaces.
* The invention has been described in detail with reference to preferred embodiments, but variations and modifications are possible within its scope.

* The invention relates to home networks with power management systems, aiming to reduce energy consumption by transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
* The invention provides methods for managing power consumption by transferring network administrative functions from a master node to a slave node, allowing the master node to enter a lower power state.
* The invention includes a network system where a network slave node can automatically promote itself to become a new network master node if the current master node fails or goes offline.
* The invention ensures that only the best qualified network slave node is promoted to the network master role, optimizing network performance and administration.
* The invention includes a method where a master node receives an instruction to enter power save mode, sends data to a slave node to perform administrative functions, and then enters power save mode itself.
* The invention includes a method where a master node receives a request to send data to a slave node, the slave node replies with acceptance, and the master node receives the data from the slave node.
* The invention includes a method where a master node receives a request to transfer administrative functions to a slave node, the slave node replies with acceptance, and the master node receives the data from the slave node.
* The invention includes a method where a slave node receives a transfer request, sends a request reply, and then receives the transferred administrative functions to become the new master node.
* The invention includes a method where a slave node waits for a transfer request, sends a request reply, and then receives the transferred administrative functions to become the new master node.
* The invention includes a method where a master node automatically becomes the master node if no beacons are found on the network, and a slave node becomes a slave node if beacons are found.

• The invention relates to an antenna array that uses equi-spaced triplets of antenna elements to measure the elevation angle of incoming radio waves, optimizing measurements at low elevation angles and overcoming ambiguity in angle determination.
• The array comprises at least four antennae arranged in triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with each triplet characterized by element spacing and center element height above the ground.
• The invention includes logic means to combine and process signals from the triplets to provide a quotient signal that represents the elevation angle, with the array capable of unambiguous angle measurement in a receive or transmit mode.

* The invention relates to a high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamp system with a liquid tight seal, addressing issues of adhesive degradation, thermal cycling, moisture ingress, and heat conduction in subminiature lamps.
* The invention utilizes a high temperature polymer seal, preferably a fluoroelastomer, to directly support and seal the glass envelope of the lamp, offering extended sealing length, heat resistance, ease of handling, and chemical resistance.
