<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and housing, enhancing heat dissipation without altering assembling conditions or housing shape at the air outlet side.
• The housing features an outwardly extending sidewall, enlarging intake airflow area symmetrically or in a frustum-conical/elliptical manner.
• The impeller's blade dimension increases with the housing's sidewall extension, enhancing airflow and heat dissipation.
• The housing's passage sidewall may have an inclined portion, beveled edge, or notch to concentrate airflow and reduce noise.
• The device can be mounted within a system casing, close to heat sources, for improved heat dissipation from electrical elements.
• The device can be paired with a heat sink, with airflow directed to the hottest part of the heat sink for efficient cooling.
• The invention's scope includes various modifications, with broad interpretation of claims to cover all such changes.
• The invention aims to increase airflow and heat dissipation efficiency without changing the fan's mounting conditions or the heat sink's housing shape.
• The device's design allows for enlarged intake airflow area and concentrated airflow to the heat sink's hottest part.
• The housing's sidewall can be extended symmetrically or in an elliptical manner, with a gradually reduced inner diameter from inlet to outlet.
• The device can be used with a CPU or other electrical elements, with the housing designed to guide airflow effectively.
• The invention includes an exploded view of the assembly with the heat sink, showing the device's positioning and airflow direction.
• The device's design can reduce noise and improve cooling efficiency compared to conventional fans.
• The invention's housing can be adapted to various systems and electrical elements, maintaining the same assembly conditions.
• The device's design can be customized for specific applications, such as gaming or high-performance computing.
• The invention's claims are broadly interpreted to encompass various modifications and embodiments.
• The device's design can be integrated into existing systems with minimal changes to assembling conditions.
• The invention

* The invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display different colors based on voltage levels without using an intermediate electrode, suitable for automotive instrument panels with high luminance in daytime and no red in nighttime.
* The display panel comprises various layers laminated on a glass substrate, with electrode stripes forming a pixel matrix, and can switch between green and lemon (green-orange) colors by adjusting voltage, offering a simple structure and low cost.

• The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony that increases flexibility in wireless communication/connection with a network or the Internet without needing specialized equipment, and offers a simple design, small size, and low power consumption.
• The invention also includes a system and method for Internet telephony that allows for dynamic IP address allocation, easy configuration with standardized equipment, and additional functionalities like news, chat rooms, and speech recognition, facilitating user operation and reducing physical dimensions of the terminal.

<summary>
* The invention relates to semiconductor structures incorporating high-dielectric oxides, particularly Pb/Bi-containing materials, with a focus on overcoming challenges associated with their integration onto semiconductor substrates.
* Pb and Bi are reactive, leading to diffusion into metals and the formation of low dielectric constant SiO2 layers at the Si/oxide interface, degrading the performance of high-dielectric oxides.
* Previous solutions using conductive buffer layers have not prevented Pb/Bi diffusion or allowed for epitaxial growth of high dielectric materials on semiconductors.
* The invention proposes using a Ge buffer layer on Si or GaAs substrates to enhance epitaxial growth and reduce reactivity, enabling the deposition of high dielectric constant oxides directly on Si or GaAs.
* Ge buffer layers are compatible with Si process technology and allow for the epitaxial growth of high dielectric constant oxides, such as BaTiO3 or PbZrO3, on top of the Ge layer.
* A thin SrTiO3 layer can be used as a buffer between Pb/Bi-containing ferroelectrics and Ge to prevent unwanted reactions and promote the formation of the desired perovskite structure.
* The invention also allows for the deposition of a second non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide layer on top of the Pb/Bi-containing oxide, potentially increasing capacitance and enabling a wider range of ferroelectric materials.
* The invention is applicable to various semiconductor structures, including capacitors, MOS transistors, pixels for light detecting arrays, and electrooptic applications.
* The invention can be used to create non-volatile, non-destructive readout memory cells by depositing ferroelectric materials directly on Si wafers, with Ge buffer layers facilitating the process.
* The invention can be applied to III-V compounds and GaAs substrates, in addition to Si, and is compatible with a wide range of conductive materials for top electrodes.
* The invention addresses the integration of ferroelectric materials for memory applications, with the Ge buffer layer preventing lead migration

* The invention introduces a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops to prevent overloading and distortion from strong signals, using control signals derived from intermediate frequency and signal frequency.
* The circuit employs PIN diodes for amplification control, ensuring minimal changes in operating current and no substantial additional power requirements during control, with the added benefit of protecting against high-voltage discharge surges.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system for spontaneously setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals using network-enabled applications on desktop computers.
• It eliminates complex and time-consuming setup processes common in prior art, allowing collaboration to begin immediately after a voice call is established.
• Each party has a collaboration indicator and button on their telephone, which, when illuminated, signals the availability of richer collaboration tools.
• Activation of the collaboration button initiates network-enabled applications on the users' desktops, allowing document sharing, video conferencing, etc., while maintaining voice communication.
• The system supports various forms of collaboration, including video conferencing, document sharing, and whiteboarding, without disrupting the voice call.
• The invention can be implemented over a network, using either a corporate LAN, WAN, or the Internet, and can also work with dedicated telephone systems.
• The system can be deployed in a two-party or multiparty collaboration scenario, with the flexibility to integrate into a peer-to-peer architecture.
• The invention can be implemented with or without a separate telephone, with the telephone functions integrated into the computer and the indicator/button provided by an input device.
• The system can be implemented using a server PC or a peer-to-peer architecture, and can support collaboration applications with FAX capability.
• The invention encompasses a computer program and any form of carrier medium that can carry the program, such as a storage medium or network signal.
• The system can be implemented with alternative configurations, such as a "one wire to the desktop" setup or with the collaboration indicator/button on the PC.
• The invention is not limited to specific embodiments and can be implemented in various ways to suit different needs and environments.
</summary>

* The invention optimizes the visual impact of an advertising clip inserted into a video sequence by ensuring continuity in terms of salience between the video sequence and the advertising clip.
* The invention relates to a method and device for processing video pictures to insert an advertising clip at a point in the video sequence, preferably at a shot change, to enhance the perception of the advertising content by the spectator.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a recessed mask structure in semiconductor devices to prevent high electrical fields at intersections, reducing localized breakdown in high-density integrated circuits.
• As dimensions approach below 150 nanometers, abrupt physical discontinuities cause high electrical fields, leading to leakage and breakdown.
• The invention uses a differentiating mask positioned below a surface to be planarized, reducing electric field concentrations and maintaining dielectric integrity.
• The mask position is typically 5 nanometers below the surface, away from high electric field points, and the mask material has a higher dielectric constant (k) than the intralevel dielectric.
• The invention minimizes the use of high k mask material by recessing it below high field points, leading to lower overall device capacitance and faster signal propagation.
• The invention includes a process for selectively etching the mask material to achieve the desired recessed structure without disturbing the conductive liner.
• The invention can be implemented with various mask materials and intralevel dielectric materials, including silicon nitride, silicon dioxide, and carbon doped oxide.
• The technology allows for the use of difficult-to-process materials in semiconductor devices by moving interfaces away from high fields and controlling capacitance.
</summary>

* The invention introduces a novel design for an analog-to-digital converter (ADC) that directly samples and downconverts a modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signal to baseband, using digital signal processing (DSP) techniques to achieve high dynamic range and low quantization noise.
* The ADC utilizes a predictive coding principle, where a predictive loop filter is implemented digitally, allowing for flexibility and re-programming of filter characteristics to match the input signal, resulting in improved dynamic range and noise performance.
* The ADC includes an offset nuller to dynamically correct for offsets introduced by various circuits, enhancing the DC offset performance of the conversion process.
* The invention also features a digital quadrature mixer (DQM) and rate reduction filters to downconvert and filter the baseband signal, with the ADC's performance demonstrated in a wireless telephone receiver implementation achieving more than 52 dB of dynamic range.

<summary>
* The invention relates to active solid state devices, specifically sensors with nanodimensional features responsive to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules.
* Nanowires and nanotubes are used for label-free direct real-time detection of biomolecule binding, with potential for high-sensitivity due to charge carrier depletion or accumulation upon binding.
* Nanowires can be fabricated using laser catalytic growth (LCG), and photolithography is used for micron-scale features, though limited by wavelength and numerical aperture constraints.
* Nanoimprint Lithography (NIL) is a method for patterning nano-scale features, offering high resolution and cost-effectiveness.
* The invention provides a method for fabricating arrays of semiconducting active layers with nano-scale features for direct electrical detection in sensing applications.
* The method involves using NIL to define semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used for multiplex detection of analytes by detecting changes in electrical conductivity.
* The fabrication process includes patterning gate electrodes, depositing a semiconducting active layer, and using NIL to pattern the active layer into nanotraces.
* The semiconducting nanotraces are functionalized with a library of sensitizing compounds, which can be nucleic acid sequences, proteins, or other molecules with specific affinities for targets.
* The multiplex detection array can detect the presence of specific targets by measuring changes in electrical conductivity when target molecules bind to the sensitizing compounds on the nanotraces.
* The invention includes a method for synthesizing anchor probe libraries on the surface of the semiconductor nanotraces using PhotoGenerated Reagent (PGR) technology.
* The multiplex detection array can be packaged onto an electronics board for signal acquisition and processing, enabling the detection of multiple targets in a single sample.
* The invention allows for the detection of various targets, including nucleic acids, proteins, small metabolites, nanoparticles, and other entities, with high specificity and sensitivity.
* The invention provides a cost-effective, time-efficient, and

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, specifically addressing the contamination issue of unplated lead surfaces in semiconductor packages.
* The method involves singulating a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single leadframe, with the leadframe being partially cut to expose and subsequently plate the side surfaces of the leads.
* The plating material used is different from the leads and is typically a metallic material that does not react with oxygen, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
* The singulation process can involve either full or partial cuts of the leadframe, with the option to plate the top or bottom surface of the leadframe before or after singulation.
* The molding compound used can have various configurations, including a top surface, bottom surface, and side surfaces with steps or beveled portions.
* The semiconductor die can be wire bonded to the leads of the leadframe, and the die can be attached to either the top or bottom surface of the leadframe.
* The invention allows for various cutting blade shapes and thicknesses, enabling the creation of semiconductor packages with different step heights and beveled side surfaces.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN) to optimize communication services.
* The invention includes a system where a WLAN access point gathers service information about neighboring WWAN base stations and transmits it to a mobile terminal, which uses this information to connect to the WWAN without initial scanning.
* The mobile terminal can switch between WLAN and WWAN based on signal strength thresholds, with the WLAN access point handling initial scanning and service information transmission.
* The invention allows for rapid switching between WLAN and WWAN to avoid connection drops, with the WLAN access point pre-scanning and providing service information to the mobile terminal for quicker WWAN connection establishment.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a simplified process for producing multilayered electrical components, eliminating costly steps in conventional capacitor manufacturing.
• The process involves creating laminate sub-assemblies by screen printing electrodes and electrical components onto flexible decals, which are then stacked in precise registration.
• The invention allows for the fabrication of various electronic components, such as capacitors, inductors, and resistors, in multiple configurations and sizes.
• The process eliminates the need for cutting and manual assembly, reducing the risk of internal delamination and micro cracks.
• The invention enables the production of smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, and non-standard shapes, with enhanced in-process inspection capabilities.
• The process reduces labor content per part and allows for rapid inventory response due to the decal form of inventory.
• The invention is adaptable to various electronic ceramic devices and can be used to fabricate precision registers and semiconductor packages.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically to materials comprising hierarchical cellular lattices and methods of using and manufacturing them.
• Sandwich panels with cores made of hierarchical lattice structures provide high specific stiffness and strength while maintaining low weight.
• The invention includes a method for creating a lattice structure with nested arrays of cells of different sizes, which are coaligned and mated to form a balanced lattice structure.
• The invention also includes a method for manufacturing the lattice structure using an injection molding process, followed by a deposition process to coat the cells with materials like graphite or silicon carbide.
• The invention allows for the creation of lightweight, high-performance sandwich panels for various applications, including transportation, armor, and thermal management.
• The invention can be used to construct materials with improved impact or blast load mitigation, and materials with superior cross-flow heat exchange.
• The invention enables the creation of armors with high ballistic resistance and the deposition of thin film batteries for high energy storage density.
• The invention can be used to create structures with controlled collapse of cells during impact, enhancing energy absorption.
• The invention allows for the inclusion of other elements within the core for various applications, such as catalyst support systems.
• The invention can be implemented in various forms, including curved structures for applications like rocket nozzles or conduits.
• The invention is not limited to specific embodiments and can be modified or varied in numerous ways, as understood by those skilled in the art.
• The invention is co-owned with the assignee and incorporates aspects of other related patent applications and scientific articles.
• The invention is intended to be within the scope of the claims provided, which include all modifications and equivalents.
• The invention is illustrated with various drawings and schematics, including unit cell structures, mated lattice structures, and manufacturing processes.
• The invention is supported by the U.S. government and has certain government rights.
• The invention is claimed under U.S. Provisional Application Ser. No. 61/038,227, filed on Mar. 20, 2

* The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, integrating an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) with a coal-to-liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis process, offering economic and environmental benefits.
* The process includes a wet gasification stage for producing high-pressure combustion gas with a high H2/CO ratio, a dry gasification stage for synthesis gas precursor with a lower H2/CO ratio, and a Fischer-Tropsch synthesis stage for hydrocarbon production, with the potential for CO2 sequestration and energy efficiency improvements.

• The invention relates to a method for preparing a solid oxide superconducting material with improved surface reliability for use in devices like Josephson elements.
• The method involves coating the oxide superconducting material's surface with a blocking film to prevent oxygen loss, which is crucial for maintaining superconductivity.
• The blocking film is applied using photo CVD, and can be converted to a dense insulating material through heat treatment, ensuring uniform oxygen concentration throughout the material.
• The invention allows for precise control of oxygen concentration in the material's surface or near-surface region, maintaining superconductivity at liquid nitrogen temperatures.
• The invention can be applied to both tablet and thin film oxide superconducting materials, with the method being effective for both monocrystalline and polycrystalline structures.
• The invention corrects the issue of surface superconductivity deterioration and enables long-term stability and high reliability in superconducting devices.

* The invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, specifically for cutting thin foam sheets without damaging their delicate cell structure.
* The apparatus allows for the creation of precisely measured, parallel-cut foam sheet cross-sections with uniform thickness, facilitating detailed microscopic examination of the foam's cell structure and quality control.

<summary>
• The invention relates to seismometers, particularly ocean bottom seismometers (OBS), and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination of such units during operation and for leveling their seismic motion detectors.
• The invention addresses challenges in OBS deployment, such as lack of control over placement and potential poor seismic coupling due to uneven surfaces.
• It offers a simple, inexpensive method to determine the seismometer's angle of inclination, aiding in understanding the ocean floor's contour and evaluating data quality.
• The invention includes a device for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors in OBS, ensuring good acoustic coupling with the ocean bottom.
• The invention comprises a mounting and clamping mechanism for seismic motion detectors that preserves the orientation assumed by the seismometer for later angle determination.
• The invention uses a pendulum-like setup with a ball and shaft, allowing the seismometer to self-level and align with the vertical for accurate operation.
• The seismometer's frame rests directly on the ocean floor, with the instrument compartment embedded in the mud for improved seismic coupling.
• The invention includes a water-tight housing with a door that provides easy access to a plunger mechanism for clamping the seismic motion detector in its locked position.
• A solenoid mechanism is used to release the plunger, allowing the seismometer to be deployed and automatically level the seismic motion detectors.
• The angle of inclination can be determined by measuring the acute angle formed by a line through the geophone's center of gravity and the spherical ball's center when the seismometer is in its normal, up-right position.
• The invention can operate until the seismometer is almost pitched over, with the potential to be adapted for greater angles of inclination.
• The invention is applicable to both vertical and horizontal seismic motion detectors, with the orientation of the detectors being parallel or perpendicular to the pendulum's line of free motion.
• The invention is described in U.S. application Ser. No. 163,757, file

• The invention introduces a humidity sensing element that is energized by low voltage microscopic currents, does not rely on mechanical movements, and is robust, non-hygroscopic, and unaffected by environmental contaminants or fingerprints. It offers a response time of about one second and is manufactured using a novel combination of familiar and non-exotic methods.
• The element comprises a first electron conductive electrode, a dielectric coating with minute particles of electron conductive material, an ion-forming material, and a second pervious electrode. The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with the relative humidity of the surrounding atmosphere when excited by an alternating current voltage.
• The preferred embodiment of the invention uses commercially pure aluminum, anodized to form a dielectric coating, with nickel particles deposited in the interstices and a second electrode formed by vacuum deposition of nickel. The sensor is suitable for excitation by a 10 Hertz sine wave alternating current electrical voltage and is designed for use in environments with temperatures between 75° F. and 85° F. and relative humidities between 40% and 85%.

* This non-provisional patent application claims priority under 35 U.S.C. §119(a) from a Chinese patent application filed in 2008.
* The invention relates to a motor assembly, specifically a force transmission structure for vehicle window lifts.
* Traditional window lift systems use a cylindrical coupling between the motor shaft and the lift device, causing vibration and noise due to impact forces.
* The invention introduces a force transmission structure with a drive plate and shaft interconnected at a common area, with a toothed portion for stable rotation.
* The drive plate features a coupling deeper than the body, a Y-shaped mounting hole with buffer holes, and protrusions for engaging a driving member.
* The shaft has a Y-shaped toothed portion with teeth fitting the mounting hole sections, and a pinion for driving a lift device gear.
* The drive plate is made of plastics, and the damper is made of rubber, with slots for engaging the protrusions.
* The shaft is held in place by a circlip within a groove in the toothed portion.
* The invention aims to reduce noise and vibration, increase torque capacity, and facilitate molding of the drive plate.
* The embodiment includes a worm driven by the motor, a worm gear meshed with the worm, and a damper attached to the worm gear, with the drive plate driven by the gear through the damper.
* The worm gear has an inner and outer ring with ribs extending from the inner to the outer ring, and the damper has slots for receiving the ribs.
* The protrusions on the drive plate are V-shaped and increase in width radially, fitting the damper slots.
* The invention provides a quieter, more efficient, and durable window lift system with improved force transmission and reduced noise.

• The invention relates to wireless communication systems, specifically for detecting, identifying, and monitoring multipath signals in WCDMA systems, with a focus on the next generation 3G systems that aim to improve transmission speeds and add mobile services.
• The invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver using a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator, which maintains the mobile time reference during idle mode to reduce power consumption and extend battery life.
• The invention includes a wideband spread spectrum multipath signal detector, identification mechanism, and multipath monitoring technique that monitors signal strength from asynchronous transmitters within a network, utilizing matched filtering, low pass filtering, and Kalman estimation for clock drift and bias recovery.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a helmet liner that can be rapidly and simply fitted to an individual's head and refitted for size changes.
* The liner is made of multiple elastic thermoplastic sheets with pockets, arranged in contact to conform to the head's contours without the need for registration or impenetrable spacer elements.
* The liner can be heated to a plastic state, fitted to the head, and cooled to retain its shape, allowing for easy adjustment to different head sizes.
* The liner does not require drawstrings or trimming after fitting, and it resists shifting on the wearer's head.
* The manufacturing process is simplified, making the liner relatively inexpensive to produce.
* The liner is designed to accommodate a range of head sizes and shapes without significant changes in inside dimensions.
* The helmet liner is secured to the helmet shell with fasteners that allow for easy alignment and adjustment.
* The invention aims to improve upon previous methods by providing a more adaptable, comfortable, and cost-effective helmet liner solution.
</summary>
